snippet: Women who were getting infected with the AIDS virus may not have taken a pill intended to prevent infection.
abstract: Scientists at the Conference on Retroviruses and Opportunistic Infections re-evaluate failure of a drug that was intended to protect healthy African women against AIDS, suggesting that many of the test subjects had not actually taken it; a number of other AIDS-related studies are presented at the conference.
lead_paragraph: Women who were getting infected with the AIDS virus may not have taken a pill intended to prevent infection.

headline.seo: Setback on AIDS Pill Is Re-Evaluated
headline.main: Setback on AIDS Drug Is Re-evaluated
headline.print_headline: Setback on AIDS Drug Is Re-evaluated
